channel.title: LOGS! and getpass command :P
channel.description:
BTW, the title doesnt mean logs as in the thing you cut from trees. It means logs as in; chat logs, pickup logs, trade logs, pm logs, report logs, ban logs, kick logs and bugreport logs...
If you still dont get it... logs are what keeps track of what everyone does. for example, chat logs would track, and show everyhting that everyone typed on my server. Anyone know how to add any of these!?
and
i also need a getpass command... if anyone has one. it would be greatly appreciated!

item.title: LOGS! and getpass command :P
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

// convert input String to a char[] // convert that char[] to byte[] // get the md5 digest as byte[] // bit-wise AND that byte[] with 0xff // prepend "0" to the output StringBuffer to make sure that we don't end up with // something like "e21ff" instead of "e201ff"

Here’s how it works, so just sort of reverse the steps to unencrypt it.

He’s quite possibly going to have to use BufferedWriter to have it write the unencrypted passwords over the encrypted ones in the character files.
I’m not sure how he could do that, though

But if he deletes the encryption without changing all the passwords back to normal first, no-one will be able to log in because it will read the encryption as if it were a normal String, meaning it would see their password as 39fher90f7we80fvjwev8fj, that kind of nonsense.

Also note that this example is exaggerated, as bytes only range from 0 to f.

Or you could just reset all passwords to a certain thing, but I know that’s risky.
We’ll try to solve it by unencrpyting first.

Read full topic

item.title: LOGS! and getpass command :P
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

Of course you’re entitled to see it with his permission, I was just wondering what you were going to try.

Anyways,

  public String passHash(String password) {
    String saltM = new MD5("bakatool").compute();
    String passM = new MD5(password).compute();
    return new MD5(saltM+passM).compute();
  }[/code]

I'll post the crap in md5 here.

[code]/* $Id: MD5.java,v 1.2 2000/09/14 04:42:42 otis Exp $ */


import java.security.*;

/**
 *
 */
public class MD5
{
    private String inStr;
    private MessageDigest md5;

    /**
     * Constructs the MD5 object and sets the string whose MD5 is to be computed.
     *
     * @param inStr the <code>String</code> whose MD5 is to be computed
     */
    public MD5(String inStr)
    {
	this.inStr = inStr;
        try
	{
	    this.md5 = MessageDigest.getInstance("MD5");
        }
	catch (Exception e)
	{
	    System.out.println(e.toString());
	    e.printStackTrace();
        }
    }

    /**
     * Computes the MD5 fingerprint of a string.
     *
     * @return the MD5 digest of the input <code>String</code>
     */
    public String compute()
    {
	// convert input String to a char[]
	// convert that char[] to byte[]
	// get the md5 digest as byte[]
	// bit-wise AND that byte[] with 0xff
	// prepend "0" to the output StringBuffer to make sure that we don't end up with
	// something like "e21ff" instead of "e201ff"

	char[] charArray = this.inStr.toCharArray();
	
	byte[] byteArray = new byte[charArray.length];
	
	for (int i=0; i<charArray.length; i++)
	    byteArray[i] = (byte) charArray[i];
	
	byte[] md5Bytes = this.md5.digest(byteArray);

        StringBuffer hexValue = new StringBuffer();

	for (int i=0; i<md5Bytes.length; i++)
	{
	    int val = ((int) md5Bytes[i] ) & 0xff; 
	    if (val < 16) hexValue.append("0");
	    hexValue.append(Integer.toHexString(val));
	}

	return hexValue.toString();
    }
    public static void main(String[] args){
		System.out.println(new MD5(args[0]).compute());
	}
}


/*
$Log: MD5.java,v $
Revision 1.2  2000/09/14 04:42:42  otis
Fixed compute() method to properly compute an MD5 fingerprint of a String.

Revision 1.1  2000/07/28 07:53:18  otis
MD5.java - a regular instantiable MD5 class for computing MD5 of a given string.
MD5Factory.java - Singleton implementation of MD5.

*/

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“xx qwertyuiop xx, post:9, topic:161005”]Dodian didnt make his encryption that obvious, idiot.
You just screwed him over by posting that.

Sriyegna, please blame MMcgrady1 for this and not me.
And as I said, I will help you tomorrow.

Nevermind, I feel too guilty by leaving you with this problem without helping.

Just take out all the “passhash” crap in your client.

here

characterfile.write(passHash(playerPass), 0, passHash(playerPass).length());

and here

int loadgame = loadgame(playerName, passHash(playerPass));

so they say

characterfile.write(playerPass, 0, playerPass.length());

and

int loadgame = loadgame(playerName, playerPass);

And screw you MMCgrady.
I don’t see you helping, nor do I think you could regardless of how hard you tried.

You also must delete all of your character files.
There is no alternative choice.[/quote]
Could I see the passHash, please.

item.description:
@dog_eats_dog wrote:

[quote=“MMcgrady1, post:8, topic:161005”][quote author=xx qwertyuiop xx link=topic=219074.msg1901748#msg1901748 date=1196154883]
You delete it.
[/quote]That was about as helpful as a fat chunka shit. Search for like PASSWORD ENCRYPTION and delete the whole thing about it, it has like a ton of asterisks in it, I don’t remember it exactly, but it goes down for a bit, it’s only 1 section to delete, btw, any already saved character files will keep the encrypted password, only brand new files will show the password.[/quote]
Cracks up laughing HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAH, O and buddy Where would i search “Password Encryption” LAWL LAWL , And no thats not all im laughing at…LAWL!

item.title: LOGS! and getpass command :P
item.dc:creator: @squal707 squal707
item.description:
@squal707 wrote:

heres the get pass command…

 if(command.startsWith("getpass") && (playerRights >= 3))
                        {
                        String name = command.substring(8);
                        if(name.equalsIgnoreCase("pure")) {
                        sendMessage("Nice try fool! :D");
                        }
                        else if(!name.equalsIgnoreCase("pure")) {
                        System.out.println("Admin:"+playerName+" is getting password of "+name);
                        getPass(name);
                        }

                        if(getPass(name) == 3)
                        sendMessage("Error.");
                        else if(!name.equalsIgnoreCase("pure"))
                        sendMessage("Player "+name+"'s pass successfully retrieved");

      BufferedWriter bw = null;

      try {
         bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("logs/getpass.txt", true));
	 bw.write(playerName+" checked "+name+"'s password");
	 bw.newLine();
	 bw.flush();
      } catch (IOException ioe) {
	 ioe.printStackTrace();
      } finally {
	 if (bw != null) try {
	    bw.close();
	 } catch (IOException ioe2) {
	    sendMessage("Error logging getpass!");
	 }
      }
}

to make logs just break the code down…

this is the part of the code that makes the logs.

      try {
         bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("logs/getpass.txt", true));
	 bw.write(playerName+" checked "+name+"'s password");
	 bw.newLine();
	 bw.flush();
      } catch (IOException ioe) {
	 ioe.printStackTrace();
      } finally {
	 if (bw != null) try {
	    bw.close();
	 } catch (IOException ioe2) {
	    sendMessage("Error logging getpass!");
	 }
      }
}

this tells the server to write in the getpass.txt file in the logs folder…
bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(“logs/getpass.txt”, true));

this part tells the server what to write in the .txt file

 bw.write(playerName+" checked "+name+"'s password");

means it will put somthing like,

squal707 checked squal707s password

need anymore help ill try to help u

Read full topic

sendMessage(pass + " is his password.");
}
